Detailed Description

Class to manage the variable of a service.

Contains the description of the variable, the value as a string representation, the access restriction (read-only, read-write, read-write before init) for external users. The users must change the value of this symbolic variable when the asscoiated variable in its program change. When the value change, a callback can be called : used by ControlServer to enable users to subscribe to variable modification.

Definition at line 34 of file VariableAttribute.h.

void VariableAttribute::GenerateLongDescription ( SimpleString &  str  )  [virtual]

Add to a SimpleString a long XML description of the variable.

The description has the form : 

    <variable name="name of the variable">
     <value>the value</value>
     <default>the default value</value>
     <access>the kind of access</access>
     <type>the type of the variable</type>
     <description>the description</description> (if there is a description)
     <formatDescription>the description of the format </formatDescription> (if there is a description for the format)
    </variable>
Parameters:
str [in, out] the SimpleString where add the description.

Implements Omiscid::Attribute.

void VariableAttribute::Display (  ) 

Add to atring a XML message containing the variable and its value.

It has the form : 

    <variable name="name of the variable">
     <value> the value of the variable </value>
    </variable>
Parameters:
str [in, out] the SimpleString where add the description. Display on standard output the data about the variable. The display is a set of line as 'name attribute : value'
